revised_title: Interdisciplinary Nature of Food Science and Technology in the 1980s
tldr: This article discusses the interdisciplinary nature of food science and technology, highlighting the contributions of various scientific disciplines to the field. It emphasizes the importance of combining knowledge from different fields, such as physics, chemistry, and biology, to develop advanced technologies in food processing, preservation, and production. The author also raises concerns about the potential gap between technological advancements and our understanding of the biological properties of food and its ingredients.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Food Studies
